About me

Hi there! My name is Qiang Fu. I am a master student in Computer Engineering at NYU and I won't bother you again with all the technical stuff here since my resume is attached.

Fun fact about me: This is actually my second master program! I have completed my first master degree in Chemical Engineering from Columbia university and discovered my passion in computer science during a coding class. With a few lines of code, I can communicate with computers and do amazing things. The power of computer science amazes me and I wish to contribute more to this magic kingdom.

View Resume

Projects

Smart Brain

'Smart brain' is a full-stack web app that uses Clarifai API to locate a face in a picture uploaded by a user via URL. User needs to register first and can sign in back to the app later with correct information. Front end is built in React and backend is built with nodeJS and Express. Database is in PostgreSQL and the app is deployed on Heroku. User's entry count is updated and stored in the backend database.

Now, let's register a new user and play with it! [Ps: It may take some time to load :)]

See Live Source Code

New York Rental Guide

This website is created with WordPress. As an international student coming to New York for the first time, I understand the painful process students go through, trying to find an affordable place to live in NYC. So I gathered all the information I found during house searching and make a rental guide for anyone who needs it!

See Live

Background Generator

This demo is built in html/CSS and deployed on Heroku. By clicking on the two color boxes, user can choose a desire background gradient and the corresponding CSS style is shown. User can paste the chosen CSS style into their own working file and create the perfect color theme for their project.

See Live Source Code

Robo Friends

This web application is built in ReactJS. It's a Card UI with different users' information in card form and can be searched dynamically through the cards by the name of user. Please try it!

See Live Source Code
